website_summaries.verdict: The 8-foot pole offers adequate reach for most users, and the inclusion of the hedge trimmer attachment makes this a good option for users who need a landscaping tool that can handle both tree branches and thick bushes.
pros: The 2 amp-hour battery offers enough run time to complete most household cutting and trimming jobs, and the automatic oiling system means users do not need to stop working to oil their chain
The 8-foot telescoping pole can reach low-hanging branches and the tops of many common household trees, while the 40-volt motor offers enough power to handle limbs of moderate thickness

Users with hedges too large for the saw will appreciate the addition of the hedge trimming tool, which offers the same power as the saw, but is able to handle even the largest hedges with its extended reach
cons: While the hedge trimmer works well on jobs requiring reach, it does not do as well on close-up jobs, and may require users to switch to the saw during hedge work

customer_reviews.title: Overheated and started to melt after 30min
customer_reviews.text: Have an array of greenworks 40volt tools. This system seamed nice but after using the hedger for 30min it overheated and started to melt. Was first use, one node on battery life and started to melt. Very disappointed, scared to use the chainsaw attachement due to this issue. Have had the lawn mower and tiller for years without a single issue. May go with another company or gas system after this. Luckily the battery is on the other end of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Parms

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: The saw and trimmer both work as expected. The battery lasts a good while. You will feel the weight of the tools, especially when using the extension. The opening for the bar oil reservoir could be larger. It is difficult to remove the battery from the tool. I had to gently pry at it with a screwdriver. I put a very light coating of WD40 on the rails and it seemed to help. All in all I think this is a great buy with both tools and the extension.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Mclane

customer_reviews.title: Awesome System!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about getting a 40v system. Was originally going to get the 80v system by Worx. This system came up cheaper then the 80v system with both trimmer and pole saw. I am sooooo glad i bought this. Greenworks is a known brand, and the 40v system works great. Just wish it came with the carry bag instead of having to purchase it separate. But it was only 14.00 on Amazon. I Love this system. Need to purchase the weed eater with the battery next. That way i have all of it. Plus 2 batteries. Highly Recommend this. I used it for trimming around the house and out at my hunting grounds. Makes easy work out of everything.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Payne

customer_reviews.title: Good concept but the hedge trimmer is worthless
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Great pole saw, extremly useful and fast cutting -Great battery life -Long extension Cons: -Feels a litte cheaply made -Battery gets stuck in the tools, hard to remove -Hedge trimmer blade is made of a very soft metal alloy and the blade surface got bent / damaged within the first 5 minutes of cutting a green (not very hard at all) bush. This prevented the hedge blade from moving. I fixed the blade with a metal file but am hesitant to use it again and resorted to my old corded hedge trimmer. -No instructions on how to properly attach the lanyard for holding the tool at max extension.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but they are heavy
customer_reviews.text: They work great. They are heavy and when the extender pole is attached you have to be very careful to control it, but with the current battery technology I don't know that this is something that can be changed. The weight of the battery does somewhat offset the weight of the long pole. The saw isn't as unwieldy. It zips right through branches though and is SO much easier than the old extendable hand saw that I used to use. I'm pretty impressed with all of the Greenworks stuff I have. I have the chain saw, weed whacker, and the leaf blower as well.
customer_reviews.author: I. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for far to reach operations, but not very functional for close ups.
customer_reviews.text: Works better very well for far to reach jobs, and the battery lasts a long time. The battery/handle section when attached to the hedger/chain saw (eliminating the pole extender), it becomes too long and non-ergonomic for close-up trims. That combination needs to be re-design to provide the same length configuration as the corded/gas powered ones. In its present configuration it renders the device useless for close-up jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This saved us over $1000 in tree clearing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because our new home had a lot of overgrowth. This has some a great job holding up. And we cut down A LOT. The battery life is solid for the size, but the whole device may be heavy for some people, especially with the extension. But Greenworks adds the support strap which can help. A few notes: - Make sure you have chain lubricant for the chainsaw - the chain can slip off, but it's pretty easy to fix - The battery can be a little tough to get out. I'm not sure why
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 1st minute of use
customer_reviews.text: Well this tool is straight garbage. Tried the hedge trimmer on probably 1/8" bush branch, and it broke on almost immediately. The metal on the blade of the trimmer bent so that it can no longer articulate and is now unusable.
customer_reviews.author: B-Rizzle

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS OIL
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on March 10, 2019. Pole saw started smoking and throwing sparks, then it stopped working on May 31. This is my second pole saw purchase with both pole saws having some sort of issues. My first one wasn’t ordered thru Amazon. These pole saws are great when they work properly, but for some reason they have something or other go wrong. Greenworks Customer Service did me right with both pole saw issues by sending me a new replacement. Both pole saws leak oil, so wrap them with a rag when transporting in a car. Also keep an eye on the chain/bar cover because it works it’s way loose, which will cause the chain to come of thr bar.
customer_reviews.author: Kalae Paddler

customer_reviews.title: works very well
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed my neighbors before buying. He had and older model and was very pleased . I was tired of climbing ladders to trim my pool surround hedges. I was able to stand on the ground and trim the hedges. Plenty of power and battery life. I also used the chain saw attachment to trim an oak tree from the ground. Liteweight enough for extended trimming time. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Being safe when you use any power type tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have some trees that really needed some work. Buying this kit was a great option. Carefully used it did exactly what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Don Wojtaszek

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I already owned a greenworks chainsaw so I knew the pole saw was likely going to be as good - and it was. Except for maybe being just a little too long, the pole saw has worked flawlessly trimming tree branches low and high. The battery has not once run out of juice. I highly recommend this trimmer if you have a large lot and need to trim trees without dragging out an extension cord or laboring to start a gas pole trimmer. I will definitely purchase again if and when this one quits working.
customer_reviews.author: Bosco

customer_reviews.title: Great for small trim jobs
customer_reviews.text: The hedge trimmer is hard to hold but good for those hard to reach spots. I have a large 2 acre home by a lake with too may trees to count. I used the pole saw virtually every weekend in the summer. Only thing to complain about is I have to continually watch the chain as it get loose after continuous use. I recommend buying a replacement chain to have on hand. I've replaced my chain twice, but I use it a lot. Takes one minute to replace. Recommend having a spare battery if you plan to use it all day. or if you're lkie me, take a
customer_reviews.author: William D Webb Jr

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is great, hedge clippers are very maneuverable,  but pole saw seems to be cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I used the pole saw for a total of about 3 hours in 2 sessions (hour and half each) and the cover that tightens the chain broke off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this set of tools but I will say that using the trimmer on the extension pole felt very awkward. I wish that you could use the trimmer without using an extension pole but instead put the battery directly on the trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Maryellen

customer_reviews.title: Really good operation
customer_reviews.text: Received the box this morning, charged the battery and started using. Pole saw chain-blade is sharp and cuts very well; hedge trimmer blades are good and cut very well, blower [extra order] is pretty good, a bit wimpy but for my purposes it's fine. I like the trimmer adjustments and not using cords or nasty 2-stroke tools. The battery lasted long enough to get a lot of work done although I see that a 4.0A would be better than the 2.0A and will add one.
customer_reviews.author: Scubated

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful hedge trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of hedge trimmer, and over 600 feet of of hedges, plus multiple large shrub features, and this is a great tool. The variable blade angle is terrific. I wasn't sure if the 40v would be up to the job, but it has been great, and much lighter than the comparable 80v pole version. It cuts better than the 40v hedge trimmer...which is also good, but does not cut low branches as well because of the blade design. Highly recommend this tool. I have not tried the saw feature because I usually use my Stihl trimmer for cutting higher branches.
customer_reviews.author: Hallas C. Midgette

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and on the 3rd or so time I used it, it just stopped working. so I took the plastic case off and found that the inside had mis-aligned and put in for an in-warranty claim. So far, it's been over 6 weeks and I've followed up three times. Still haven't heard anything, not so much as an update. Just a "please note due to COVID there will be a delay...". So, I wasted a lot of my money on a hedge trimmer that's now a piece of trash and i cant use it in the summertime when i need it the most. Can't recommend anyone buy one and end up like me.
customer_reviews.author: Ringtail

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for three price point; works well and seems reliable
customer_reviews.text: Works great and quality ok. Battery lasts a good couple hours which is more than enough for some hedge trimming and pole sawing. Used it a few times since purchasing and it seems reliable and still works well. Recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Good, but had to return it.
customer_reviews.text: The saw and trimmer both have a lot of power even for larger branches that I thought wouldnt work. I had to return it because the blade of the trimmer kept jamming and hitting eachother. The blade of the saw kept falling out. Would be nice if they included oil for the chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Kayman

customer_reviews.title: Non Working Trimmer = Non Returnable Item
customer_reviews.text: Trimmers lasted about 15 minutes before it no longer worked. I tried to return combo set to AMAZON but found out I needed to call Greenworks to return. Bottom line, replacing / returning NOT CONVIENANT and replacement will take weeks
customer_reviews.author: Msko

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: hedge trimmer jammed the first time I used it. Customer service 1(888) 909-6757, told me I had over an hour and a half wait on hold. I e-mailed them through the Amazon system. No response. It is now 2 weeks later still no response from Greenworks... I took the trimmer apart loosened the screws (hex head) that hold the trimmer blades together. took pliers pushed the blades together. I put the cover back on (star screws) assembled the pole trimmer tested it. It worked and with no help from green works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery won’t charge after three uses.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw and trimmer, but battery failed to take a charge after only three uses. Filled out a product support form on their website and got an error message.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hinchliffe

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and fast tools
customer_reviews.text: Both of these tools are very powerful. Seem well made. Saw is easy to adjust the chain which stretches a lot on first use then settles in. Battery life better than expected even with the 2 amp hour battery. I have a 2 and a 4 hour battery and the tools are pretty heavy when using the 4 amp. Tools are well balanced though with either battery. Used these for a few hours the day I got them and never did kill the 4 amp battery after running the 2 amp pretty low. Very happy with these so far.
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: GOT TO USE IT TWICE BEFORE IT BROKE.
customer_reviews.text: I am very very very upset. Going to set up to do some tree trimming. Put in the extension to see if it was long enough to do the job, which it was. Came to take it apart (the extension) and I was unable to separate the saw from the extension without pulling the plug apart making it unusable. So here I am having a job to do and no saw to do it. I need a quick resolution how do I get this replaced. Included is a picture to clarify what I just said. Thank you Dennis
customer_reviews.author: DIMWIT

customer_reviews.title: Very good saw, needs to be a bit lighter and telescoping head would be nice
customer_reviews.text: Product is heavy, initially a bit painful to connect the rods but loosens up after a few uses. Reach is not very good for taller palm trees. Have not used the hedging tool yet, used another hedging tool from the same manufacturer. Saw is good quality and does the job pretty well. Trimmer a lot of trees and branches in my front and back yard. Saved me over $400 on a single use. Didn't need to call out a guy to trim my palms or my trees so didn't have to worry about scheduling etc..
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: Trimming fruit trees
customer_reviews.text: Love this, makes yard work a bit easier. As long as I don’t extend the pool too far I can manage a few hours yard work. Extended lucky if I get three branches cut before my arms give out. I’m a weakling. Someone with upper body strength would fine Battery lasts much longer than expected
customer_reviews.author: Alyce_Marie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those things you buy, and after you use it, you think, why did I not buy this years ago. Can't believe how well this cuts. I did my front, side and back bushes and still had battery life. I also used the saw, and trimmed tree branches that I've always wanted cut. It is heavy, so be careful when it's fully extended, use the shoulder strap, if you can get it to stay on... Lovely trimmer, great purchase. Very good customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Bostonnet

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed with the power and sturdiness of the tool.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy when I saw the girth of the saw/trimmer shaft. It's all heavy duty. It's a very sturdy product. The saw and trimmer do what the manufacturer claims. I've been using it for a month now cleaning up my overgrown property. When I have the extension on and am reaching up high, it does get heavy on my arms and shoulders after a while. I don't fault the product for this. It is sturdy and powerful, and is serving me well to maintain my rural property.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 40V cordless pole saw.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these tools because of the quality of a previous purchase of the Greenworks 40V battery powered leaf blower/vac. Just used it for the first time. Man, this is a sweet tool! Really a great quality tree trimming chain saw. Really like the length of it. Have 2 batteries (40V) from previous purchase of the Blower Vac, so I can trim away. This is a neat set of battery powered tools, and I like being able to use the same batteries to power all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Tool for Tall Hedges and Low Hanging Trees
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, this set has been great. After a couple months use on a tall hedge and with several over hanging trees this gets an easy 5 stars. You cant get around physics and when used fully extended overhead (the center extension can be removed for lower applications) this is a bit of an upper body workout. But the weight is less than expected for a unit with these abilities. Battery life has exceeded owners stamina on each use. The recharter is relatively quick. Seems well built and has taken some relatively big jobs in stride. Would recommend without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Olivant

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit leery of a battery powered hedge trimmer and pole saw. I have changed my mind on this. I own gas powered edgers and hedge trimmers that don't do as well as this Greenworks product. I used the pole saw as I would my chainsaw and the battery powered right through everything. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy Peacock Adams

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks products improved the quality of my life.
customer_reviews.text: I am 63 yo that has several limitations so gas power anything is very difficult for me. My yard suffered greatly but once I learned about Greenworks and their battery powered products my yard looks great. Greenworks is a name that everyone should know. Built to last so very easy to use no gas fumes low vibration with good customer service. I wish I knew earlier. I have a mower, pole saw with a hedge trimmer for now but I plan to purchase other tool from them i the near future. A very happy liberated customer TY Greenworks.
customer_reviews.author: Rickey Bechard

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got this
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to trim grass and weeds around a pond. A weed wacker would do the job but too much debris ended up floating on the water for a couple days. Instead, trim the weeds as you move the blade away from the water. Also found it much easier to trim tall shrubs than a regular hedge trimmer. Next, it's really good for trimming down in a stream bed. Impressed with the chainsaw. Great for trimming branches. Battery life is surprisingly good. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace the older model that I broke. This one is an improvement in quality to the last one. It comes with a strap to make it easier to hold. I find that the strap helps a lot because it is a bit top heavy. I am a 66 year old women and had little trouble using it. The saw attachment surprized my husband as to how well it worked when cutting some fairly large branches. Highly recommend this tool!
customer_reviews.author: gac

customer_reviews.title: Extended tool length
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful when comparing the weight of these battery units. This tool's cutting appliances are said to weigh 11 pounds, which is fair. The issue here is that the 11 pounds is at the end of a pole that makes it feel heavier and more difficult to handle and use. I am over 6 foot tall and over 200 pounds and I found the cutting configurations difficult to manage, especially for any period of time. As such, I returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The tool it’s self is good but,,
customer_reviews.text: I like the tool , to do hard to reach areas , the battery last long enough to do the job, my biggest complaint, the trimm hedger stop working after few times I used I wish I can get this problem solve , cause other than that I do like the tool !
customer_reviews.author: luis f rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the second use, no response from Greenworks
customer_reviews.text: The hedge trimmer is complete garbage! I used it once to trim a small hedge with stems no wider then 1/4 inch. Went to use it again a month later in the same hedge and the machine jammed and the metal on one of the blades bent into another one and the whole machine stopped working. Apparently the gears on the inside are weak and strip really easily. Have emailed Greenworks 3 times and got no response!
customer_reviews.author: TFranklin

customer_reviews.title: Great tool even for a woman.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 69yr old woman and this is so easy to use. Great lettle invention. I also have their larger chain saw. I share 5he battery.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Casale

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as Gas unit
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor has a gas version of the pole saw. It is really heavy and you are exhausted after working with it for any period of time. This one is so easy to use, add chain oil, insert the battery and you are ready to go. I have used it for 45 minutes in a row and yet to run out of battery. While I only cut smaller branches it works just as well as the gas one, Now my neighbor comes over to borrow mine vs use his Gas pole saw
customer_reviews.author: David Harris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have a ton of Greenworks products and love them all! The only challenge with this is you need a lot of arm strength to support it while trimming. It reaches the top of large bushes nicely and the saw cuts through branches with ease. No trouble with battery life either. The strap that goes around the shoulders is a bit difficult to use and not comfortable but I've yet to find one for home use that is.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rutter

customer_reviews.title: Charger doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I used the edger out of the box last fall, battery came charged. When I recharged last weekend for the first time. Charger does not seem to work. The lights on the first indicating how much of the battery is charged does not light up. I left on all weekend so was not for the lack of time to charge the battery. I've emailed the manufacture to send me a new charger and no response other than the automated response. Unit worked ok on day one.
customer_reviews.author: msantas

customer_reviews.title: YOU MIGHT GET A REFURBISHED ITEM- I DID
customer_reviews.text: Horrible packaging- ripped box on both ends, the whole product was used ( probably refurbished ) I didn’t pay for a refurbished item. Had it not been for how good the hedge trimmer works, I’ve would returned it. Theres scratches all over and black marks, definitely used, they can’t say they test it first before we send it- too many marks and scratches on it. Haven’t used the chain saw because I need to buy chain lube, but any hiccup and I’m sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Robust design
customer_reviews.text: Much more robust design than the earlier extendable hedge trimmer which ended up falling apart on me. I love the idea of the interchangeable chainsaw/trimmer and both work very effectively when attached. Changing them over can be a pain as the parts do not separate easily. Make sure you remove the battery before separating so you don't have a bad accident while manhandling it. Similarly, the battery gets stuck! Time to review again guys. "A" for concept, "C" for execution
customer_reviews.author: CDurham

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Greenworks tools for lawn are for a year. Really like them. So I decided to add to my arsenal. The pole saw and shears came a week or so back. I’ve trimmed my trees and my neighbor’s. The unit is powerful. I can use it from the ground or up on a ladder and feel in control. It’s paid for itself in the work I’ve done with it instead of hiring a crew.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Became heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! I've used it on shrubs, bushes, and palm trees. The battery never failed and I was able to finish my tasks on a single charge. I bought a second battery to have a backup, but never had to use it. I'd say a good hour+ on one battery. My only complaint is when I used the extension pole and had to hold it up over my head. It became heavy and difficult to balance after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Patti and Darrell

customer_reviews.title: The hedge trimmer is useless
customer_reviews.text: The metal of the blade of this hedge trimmer is very soft, it got bent within my first 10 minutes of use. It’s just a normal size bush without thick sticks. The bent part stops the blade from moving. The pro of this set is that the chain saw is working well, the battery life is pretty long and it supports at least half an hour of work
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: WOW, if you don't need a battery, this is a great deal.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a monster. With the extra supplied extension, you can almost touch the stars. Have not used the pole saw attachment yet but it looks like it means business. I had a 4 amp hour batter that came with my snow blower so this was just what I was looking for. I checked the batter life feature based on the two batteries I already have. There is another extension available but I don't recommend it. Things can be too long you know.
customer_reviews.author: Europabase

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: As the bushes have gotten larger over the years, it has become difficult to reach the back of the bushes/across the bushes and to the top of the bushes. The hedge trimmer made this so much easier! Although it was a bit heavy, it was very usable at the level needed. No problem reaching across to the back of the bushes. Highly recommend it. Battery power was great, length worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good battery life. Cutting in saw and trimmer is very sharp. Only downside is that the battery is extremely hard to remove--noted in other reviews as well.
customer_reviews.author: SJH

customer_reviews.title: Pole saw is awesome but hedge trimmer could be better
customer_reviews.text: Pole saw is awesome. Cuts very well and the center extension pole is really nice for getting higher branches. The hedge trimmer is decent. Nothing great but gets the job done as long as the leaves/ hedge branches are not thick. The blade metal is thin and will bend if you hit a branch that is thicker than about 1/8 inch thick.
customer_reviews.author: dragon4785Top Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: This will make your work easy and fun!
customer_reviews.text: The power is amazing, just like gas! It is of high quality and the design is great. The hedgetrimmer articulates for those high and low places that are hard to get to. The chainsaw has an oil resevoir to oil the chain while cutting. It is a little heavy, but still way lighter than a gas one. Battery last a long time. The price is awesome, two tools for the price of one.
customer_reviews.author: BOJO

customer_reviews.title: Love my new tools..... More powerful then expected!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am very impressed and happy with the Greenworks saw and hedge trimmer. I already owned the leaf blower and weed trimmer and love them. Thought this would be a good buy to have another battery, more tools, and a nice matching set. First time using them I was AMAZED they actually work much better than expected. I trimmed all the bushes in the front with zero problems and made fast work of a job. Then cut and shaped a large tree and was cutting branches 4-5 inches thick with no major issues. Highly recommend these tools! (P.s. - don't forget to buy BAR OIL for the saw and check it after use.)
customer_reviews.author: Jason Folker

customer_reviews.title: Oh yeah, it’ll do it.
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw works! Not industrial grade but it doesn’t have to be for a home owner who needs to prune some limbs. There is a 2’ 6” extension available that really increases reach. It did everything that I needed. It oils the bar and chain almost too well. A face shield helps. Check out the photos. The $15 bag is a good add on. I also got the 12” chain saw, another perfectly adequate tool. Both just get 4 stars until they last for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Lon

customer_reviews.title: useful
customer_reviews.text: everything worked well, both attachments are nice to have. long battery runtime. have a plug in 8" pole saw but use this one all the time because of convenience. Brother and father borrow all the time. would recommend. 10 acres is too big to have an extension cord run to where i need to cut and this seems to have just as much power as a plug in.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good pole saw, hedge trimmer not so good.
customer_reviews.text: The over all unit when fully extended is a bit heavy but I think that is the nature of the device. The pole saw works great. The hedge trimmer blades are too soft or light. When I hit a part of the bush that is too thick the hedger stops as expected but it also pushes the blades into each other. That bends and cuts the blades which then have to be disassembled to fix. I also had to use my Dremel to grind the blades a bit to fix the damage it did to itself. If I had a need to purchase this device again I would only purchase the pole saw and not the hedger.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Dave

customer_reviews.title: Chain saw cuts like butter.
customer_reviews.text: Chain saw cuts through like butter and the trimmer works well. Also, as an added bonus, working it fully extended gives you a great arm workout. I would buy again...love GreenWorks!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Falbo

customer_reviews.title: Original Product? With after market batteries!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this trimmer because I had ordered two more Greenworks products and they were great. Unfortunately, we just received it with a battery that has a label of Greenworks but it looks like the copies you can find cheaper. On top of this, I called the Greenworks customer service and a very rude lady answered the phone. Sorry but that is not the way to treat customers. Bad attitude since she picked up the call. I had to order a replacement after calling Amazon customer service (as always great customer service no matter who is the rep), but now I have to wait another week to get it shipped. Very disappointed with the experience!
customer_reviews.author: JasonViewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pole Saw and Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw replaced my electric chorded pole saw. It's so much easier to move around the yard without having to deal with the extension cord. The pole extensions allow me to cut down branches that are hard to reach, and the extensions using the trimmer allow me to trim tall bushes. The adjustable angle of the trimmer is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: CDF3

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Using trimmer for 7ft high shrubs and pole saw for palm trees. The battery is very powerful and I have not drained it in a single use yet (working in the yard for 45min avg). The fit and finish is very good, I will continue to buy Greenworks lawn products for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Connor McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long. Great tool though.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in August of 2019. It is 1 year old and the motor is gone in it. I barely use this and it is garage kept. They have not answered in 2 months. When they finally did, I have been trying to prove to them that I bought it on here. They say my screenshots of amazon aren’t enough. Do not buy this POS. Junk merchandise and terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: If I had gotten it for the hedge trimmer alone , I would be satisfied. Lots of issues with chainsaw tho. Constantly have to keep tightening nut that holds the bar. Don't trim anything too near the house, etc, the oil sprays all over everything. It's also awkward to use with all extensions. Batteries last well, but are a pain to pull out.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T.

customer_reviews.title: I've only used the chain saw once & the hedger trimmer once but I really love them.
customer_reviews.text: I used the chain saw to trim all the small dead limbs from the inside of my pine trees canopy. I haven't had time to use the extension pole to get up higher in the trees yet but it's next on my list. I have a hedge that's become to tall for this old lady to trim with my regular electric hedger but this Greenworks trimmer made the job much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing hedge trimmer chainsaw combo tool.
customer_reviews.text: Used trimmer attachment for 20 minutes and the attachment failed. Battery was fully charged so the problem was with the trimmer head which was rather flimsy and not up to the task. The motor in the trimmer head smelled like burned electronics. I would say that the trimmer is only up to light duty tasks at the most. I would not recommend to purchase this item. I returned to amazon and they immediately refunded my purchase when I dropped the package off to UPS. which made me very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott  Spern

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This thing is strong and the battery life was impressive. The downsides are minimal. You have to add chain oil and adjust the chain often. But given that, the darn thing works great. It's a bit on the heavy side too, but hey, you want one that works well, it might have to have some weight.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fixit

customer_reviews.title: Great company!
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 2 uses but contacted Greenworks and they are sending me a new one. When used it worked great. Update: Greenworks sent me a completely new replacement which is unheard of, this comes with a 4 year warranty which is also unheard of. I will certainly do business in future with them
customer_reviews.author: doug kyper

customer_reviews.title: Hedge Trimmer Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I installed the hedge trimmer and it doesn't work. It only clicks and then stops. I've been trying to get product support from Greenworks for sometime and there is no reply or response from them. It's a shame because I bought so many Greenworks tools, but I won't be purchasing from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Rectems

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tool. My wife loves the hedge trimmer attachment and she uses it constantly. I was concerned about the battery and the overall durability of this tool because I planned to use it on some pretty large jobs on our quarter mile long driveway that is fully wooded. I might upgrade and add another battery eventually so I have one as back up. I'm very pleased with the product and I enthusiastically recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: man de music

customer_reviews.title: Cannot handle basic twigs
customer_reviews.text: Use this to cut an annoying neighbor's tree that's growing over into my yard I was only able to make 1 or 2 cuts before the metal on the blade got jammed as you can see in the picture halfway down. The metal is bent! Motor started smoking! I didn't use pole saw. Very disappointing. My Dewalt trimmer easily able to handle. Will be returning this and getting Dewalt pole trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: amit

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor saw me using a manual pole trimmer to lop off some high branches and offered his cordless pole saw - wow - was I impressed! I also had some hedges that I had to get a ladder out to trim which was a total pain and kinda dangerous. This worked so well I had to buy my own and absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: L. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Hedge trimmer blades cut into each other
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for this product for the long reach hedge trimmer but the first time I used it, when it hit a branch a bit too thick, it immediately stopped. Upon inspection, it appears the blades got crossed and cut into each other as shown in the photo. I got a replacement but after cutting for less than a minute the same thing happened. The pole saw worked fine but I can't recommend this product if the hedge trimmer is such poor quality that the blades cut into each other. Sure wish it had worked!
customer_reviews.author: Denise M.

customer_reviews.title: Why hire a professional?
customer_reviews.text: I received a quote from a tree cutting service and they quoted me $200 to cut some tree branches. Instead, found this bad boy on Amazon for $110 and cut the branches myself. Saved $90 and now I have a hedge trimmer and branch cutter at my disposal. With the extension, it makes the tool a little heavy to handle, which is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lim

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool Set
customer_reviews.text: We have a 10’ hedge in our front yard that needs regular attention. Bought this set for my 14 yo son to attack it every month. With this set, the boy has done an amazing job. He’s been at it well over 40 minutes and the battery is still going. Love dumping all our gas powered tools.
customer_reviews.author: Rather Be Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Way too heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty average in strength I think but I could barely lift this thing above my head which defeated the purpose of having it on a pole. If I get far enough under it to lift it high, I couldn't reach the switch. I returned it. Btw, it also kept stopping, constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Janette

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like the power this thing has. The chainsaw is excellent and I cut down a lot of 2" - 6" limbs with it. The hedge trimmer on the longer handle allowed me to cut hedges I used to need a ladder for. In short, I love it. I can't wait to get it back from my brother who borrowed it, and also loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Pinckney12

customer_reviews.title: Great tool package
customer_reviews.text: love both items. My old 20v adj wxt hwdge trimmer cracked at key joint after sevwrla years - plastic/metal fatigue too bad as it still worked fine and frame parts no longer available. New 40v saw is awesome and trimmer fine but may a bit heavy for some folks.
customer_reviews.author: Randman

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working at 45 days.  I probably used it 3 times at most
customer_reviews.text: Not so happy. had less than 2 months and stopped working. I wasn't thrilled with it when it arrived but my husband thought it would be useful. Here we are and didn't even get a full summers use. used at most 3 times and now it won't even cut a blade of grass. Do NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: It Stopped Working after a few Hours
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 40V Pole saw/trimmer. Amazon sold as NEW IN BOX. I received my Pole saw/trimmer...Amazon box was open but the parts all seemed there. I charged battery and next day used it. I wore out before battery did. I LOVED the unit ! Did a great job. Happy ! Then...Next day I tried to finish up and wasn't long before the power stopped and started clicking. I thought it was battery low...so I charged and tried again later. DEAD. Nothing. I thought bad trimmer, so put the saw attachment on. Nothing. I'm PISSED. I see no serial number anywhere on unit and it came with Manual, but no paperwork whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works great! Batter charges really fast. We ordered one and had a little problem with the hedge trimmer out of the box but a replacement was sent and we have used both the trimmer and chain saw. Wish we would have purchased this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: Shoes Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 40v Hedge Trimmer is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: No more cut cords!! I can do 90% of my trimming from the ground, so it is a real blessing. So far (1 use) the battery life is quite good and the trimmer cuts as well as my Black and Decker corded trimmer. While the reach is fantastic you have to stand back a bit from what you are cutting because of the length of the shaft, but that is quite OK. I also like the adjustability of the head which makes trimming that much easier. I really like it. Great Tool. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Sid Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and No cords
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something that didn't require a connection to electricity. This was great. It is not too heavy and really lasts. Saved the cost the first two times I used it to do the trimming because of what it would have cost to hire someone.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Wrong battery included
customer_reviews.text: The product works well but I noticed the included battery is not marked Gmax nor does it look anything like the picture. I have contacted Greenworks to see what they have to say.
customer_reviews.author: R V

customer_reviews.title: NICE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: He likes this combo and the battery concept. Always buy extra charger and batteries for backup and have them charged. Better than gasoline and trailing electric wires and extension cords. Best price on amazon with free prime shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma and Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Finally something i can use to evenly trim my trees. You can stand back and see what you're cutting. I've recommended this product and a couple of neighborhood gardeners have also bought the product after I've shown them the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hedge Trimmer Broke
customer_reviews.text: This was the third time using the hedge trimmer and it broke on a thin branch. Since the amazon return date had passed, I proceeded to open up the trimmer section and noticed the two teeth on one of the fly wheels had broken off. The chain saw section works with the tools, so I used that to complete my work. What a shame. Even though the product is heavy, I liked the overall length and ability to reach those hard to reach areas without a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: GJO

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to connect the sections, easy to start the hedge trimmer and chain saw. BUT, the hedge trimmer broke 5 minutes Into a very soft 1/4 soft shoots. CHEAPLY MADE. Usually it was a well made product. Looks like it is going down hill.!
customer_reviews.author: moto-x

customer_reviews.title: Saw blades installed backwards, easy fix though.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set, however the power saw blade was factory installed backwards!! Easy fix, no tools needed: I removed and rotated 180 degrees and easily rips through limbs now. The trimmer with extensions creates a long reach, no need for a ladder anymore. Trimmer head is pivotal, very nice.
customer_reviews.author: vet

customer_reviews.title: Teeth misaligned first use
customer_reviews.text: I am a pretty big Greenworks Fan. I have committed to their 40v system on most of my garden tools. HOWEVER I am disappointed in my experience with the pole hedge trimmer. It jammed with 5 minutes of my first use. The metal teeth got out of line and bit into each other. There are no instructions in the booklet or online that I can find on how to resolve this. I emailed Greenworks more than a week ago with no response yet. I will try to call this week.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best equipment purchase this year next to their chain saw.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it. It is light weight, quiet, and the battery usually lasts longer than he does. Perfect for a 74 year old guy who enjoys yard work but can no longer wield those heavy, hard to start, gas powered ones.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Guru

customer_reviews.title: replacement warranty
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product for three usages. The hedge clippers stopped working(click,clicks,sound). Chain saw still works. Called manufacturer for warranty replacement and they are out of stock until October? Not to happy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert coleman

customer_reviews.title: Look at another product
customer_reviews.text: Hedge trimmer stopped working on the third day of use. Seems built for extremely light work. No product support by phone. Very dissatisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Silverio

customer_reviews.title: Saw good. A little heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Saw works very well. The hedge trimmer could be better. My hand held is easier to use, but it got the job done. I’m a 67 year old woman and it was heavy for me. But I had 8’ bushes that needed to be trimmed and it did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.text: Have been impressed with it so far. Trimmed no. of limbs and cuts well and battery is lasting, have not had to charge it yet after about 2 hours of work, so better than anticipated. Goes through the bar chain oil so monitor that. It is a bit heavier than anticpated, so the wife has a bit of an issue, however if the weight is the trade off for a bit more power it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: vpops

customer_reviews.title: Overall not pleased
customer_reviews.text: My excitement was cut short when I used the hedge trimmer it was maybe on for about 2 minutes and it jammed up and won’t cut back on. The saw has an occasional slip but works great. This tool is really heavy because of the extensions. I recommend splitting your work in two days if you have a lot of trees like I do. Overall not pleased I have to send both items back due the hedge trimmer not cutting back on.
customer_reviews.author: Jai

customer_reviews.title: pole hedge trimmer jammed up on the first time
customer_reviews.text: i've wrote to greenworks about this problem and no response from them. i haven't used the chain saw but i beleve this works fine. if at all possible would like to retrun for a replacement with just the hedge trimmer part. not the rest of the pole. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Ron Morrison

customer_reviews.title: A Great buy if you have trees you need one
customer_reviews.text: Only used the pole saw and it beat my expectations. Battery lasted longer than i wo ld hsve thought. It does go through the oil so make sure you keep oil so bade will lasr. Wish i would have bought one sooner
customer_reviews.author: Dbg

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I have been using this for a few months now. I’ve cut down limbs and I have cut down trees. Largest tree is approx 14” in diameter. I love this tool. Going to get the chain saw now!!! The hedge attachment works just as great!
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received broke on the first day of use of the trimmer and saw. Easy return policy with Kohls, Returned, and sent me new one, and its paid for its self. I do work for HOA on the side and used it to trim up hiker/biker trail and cut down small trees. It worked great. Its a little heavy, but with the strap, they give you it works great. Would recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: ecteljoe

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer Failed First Use and No Response to Warranty Requerst
customer_reviews.text: Pole saw has been working well and compares favorably to the Kobalt $40V I have been borrowing to use. Hedge Trimmer Jammed on first use. I have been unable to contact company directly ("You're #69 in line " and the wait time was nearly two hours) and calling is only available 9 to 5 Monday through Friday. Email submission (which is a message attached to the warranty registration) was not acknowledged and has had no response in nearly three weeks.
customer_reviews.author: James L Rutland

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.  Battery is heavy, but it has big capacity.
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality and ease of use of my kit. The battery is larger and heavier than expected, but it does hold a long charge. I've already purchased other items to go along with my kit.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nixon

product_meta.title: Greenworks 8 Inch 40V Cordless Pole Saw with Hedge Trimmer Attachment 2.0Ah Battery and Charger Included PSPH40B210
product_meta.description: Size:Battery IncludedThe Greenworks 40V system is the largest collection of premium lawn tools with up to 25 or more tools on one battery platform. Save by buying tool only models, or with battery. There is no task that can't be completed with the Greenworks G-MAX 40V system. Chain Tensioning - Tool-less
feature_bullets: G-max 40V li-ion battery system powers multiple tools for complete yard system--includes 2Ah battery and charger
20-Inch steel dual action blade for optimal performance and durability
8 inch pole saw for easy trimming of branches. Pole Saw Weight (without battery)-8.38 pounds. Pole Hedge Trimmer Weight (without battery)- 9.57 pounds
Automatic oiler applies oil to bar and chain when needed to ensure durability and optimal use with a translucent oil tank for clear view of oil level

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars799 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
